New Records: Mikel Merino's goal gave Spain a 2-1 victory over hosts Germany in Extra Time of the quarterfinal of Euro 2024 at the MHP Arena in Stuttgart on Friday.
Key Match Events: Dani Olmo for Spain opened the scoring after half-time
Wirtz for Germany late in the second half to bring back the game on level terms
Mikel Merino scored in extra time to seal the win for Spain
Dani Carvajal takes a red and he is asked to leave the ground now
Moreno scores here in the final moments of the game and that should be it
Pre-Game Insights: Julian Nagelsmann, Germany coach ahead of game: 'It's not a final, it's a quarterfinal. We want to be one of the teams in the semifinal. Spain want to be champions as well, so it'll be a tough game.'
Luis de la Fuente, Spain coach ahead of game: 'It's going to be an equal game. It could have been the Euro final and I think it'll be an even game on a footballing level.'
Post-Match Reflections: With the win, Spain remains unbeaten in the tournament in five games and qualifies for the semifinals of the tournament where they will face either France or Portugal who will face off each other tonight
Miscellaneous Highlights: The goal from Wirtz is the first goal anyone has scored against Spain all this tournament
This is an extremely tricky phase of this game and both teams don't want to blink here
The stadium is buzzing here in Germany it is going to be a cracking game of football
